revised_title: The Life and Death of Marcello Malpighi: A Posthumous Account
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of the life, death, and autopsy findings of Marcello Malpighi, a renowned Italian physician and anatomist. Malpighi's autopsy revealed the presence of a large amount of extravasated blood in the right ventricle of the brain, which was believed to be the cause of his death. The article also discusses Malpighi's contributions to the field of medicine and his planned future research before his untimely death.
